intro: Columnea corymbosa, commonly known as the clustered flame flower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its vibrant, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or vine, often climbing or trailing along supports. Its foliage consists of opposite, ovate leaves with a glossy surface. Columnea corymbosa thrives in humid, shaded environments and is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value.
